Is this a bug?  I have a package Foo in my JULIA_LOAD_PATH.  If I do:
```julia> using Foo
[ Info: Precompiling Foo [top-level]
ERROR: LoadError: ArgumentError: Package HTTP not found in current path:
- Run `import Pkg; Pkg.add("HTTP")` to install the HTTP package.```
So then I try
```(v1.5) pkg> activate Foo
(Foo) pkg> add HTTP
> using Foo
using Foo
[ Info: Precompiling Foo [984f741b-9a08-4955-ba0e-338b96f43b49]
┌ Warning: Package Foo does not have HTTP in its dependencies:
...```
What appears to be going on is that it only looks in cwd()/Foo for the Project.toml instead of in JULIA_LOAD_PATH/Foo.  Do I have to cd to Foo/.. every time to be able to manage the package depedencies properly?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
your `]activate Foo` didn't activate your `Foo`, it activated an environment at `pwd()/Foo`
presumably, `pwd()` is not the directory your `Foo` is located at

I think that workflow is reasonable though, so opening an issue at `<https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/>` for allowing `]activate MyPkg` to activate environments from LOAD_PATH seems reasonable to me
